title: Sports briefs Thursday
text:
(0) Comments COLLEGE FOOTBALL 
P.J. Walker threw a late 23-yard touchdown pass to Robby Anderson , and No. 22 Temple rallied to beat East Carolina, 24-14, on Thursday night in Greenville, N.C. 
Walker finished 19 of 35 for 250 yards for the Owls (7-0, 4-0 American Athletic Conference). They ensured their first appearance in the Top 25 since 1979 — and the best start in school history — will last a little longer. GOLF 
Canada's David Hearn birdied his final three holes in perfect morning conditions for a 7-under 64 and a share of the lead in the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open in Las Vegas. 
Michael Thompson , Mark Hubbard and Tyler Aldridge also topped the leader board at TPC Summerlin. Aldridge had two holes left when first-round play was suspended because of darkness. 
Menomonee Falls native Mark Wilson opened with a 69. 
LPGA Tour: Ji Eun-hee shot a 6-under 66 to take a one-stroke lead over Lin Xi-yu in the Taiwan Championship in Taipei. GYMNASTICS 
Chris Brooks will replace injured three-time U.S. champion Sam Mikulak on the national team at the world championships, which begin Friday in Glasglow, Scotland. 
Mikulak suffered minor ankle injury in training earlier this month. 
Milwaukee's Marvin Kimble will serve as the first reserve as the U.S. tries to back up its bronze medal finish at the 2014 world championships. BASKETBALL 
Lamar Odom is believed to have overdosed on cocaine and other drugs before he was found unconscious in a Nevada brothel, according to search warrant records. 
The court document includes testimony to a Nevada state judge from Michael Eisenloffel , a Nye County sheriff's detective, on Oct. 13 after the former National Basketball Association star was found at the Love Ranch in Crystal. 
"I believe that Mr. Odom may be — or may have been — under the influence of a controlled substance," Eisenloffel told Fifth Judicial District Judge Robert Lane . 
Odom was hospitalized in Las Vegas and transferred to Los Angeles. SKIING 
Two-time overall champion Anna Fenninger will miss the entire World Cup season after seriously damaging her right knee during a training crash in Soelden, Austria. 
The Austrian skier underwent surgery after tearing ligaments in a fall during a giant slalom run. Fenninger was transported by helicopter to a clinic in nearby Innsbruck after the incident. SOCCER 
Darian Powell tallied twice to lead the Marquette University women's team (7-6-4, 4-2-1 Big East) to a 2-0 victory over Villanova at Valley Fields. 
From Journal Sentinel wire reports © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved.
